entities.name: NVIDIA
entities.description: NVIDIA is a technology company that specializes in the development of GPUs and AI software. It has a platform strategy that integrates hardware, systems, software, algorithms, and services to create value for various markets. NVIDIA has invested over $29 billion in R&D since its inception and is known for its invention of the GPU in 1999 and the CUDA programming model in 2006. NVIDIA's GPUs are used in high-performance computing, gaming, AI, and various industries including transportation, healthcare, and financial services. The company is headquartered in Santa Clara, California, and was incorporated in April 1993.

entities.name: SOFTBANK GROUP CORP.
entities.description: SoftBank Group Corp. is a multinational conglomerate that was involved in a Share Purchase Agreement with NVIDIA to sell Arm Limited. The agreement was terminated due to significant regulatory challenges.

entities.name: ARM LIMITED
entities.description: Arm Limited is a semiconductor and software design company that was the subject of a Share Purchase Agreement between NVIDIA and SoftBank Group Corp. The agreement was terminated due to significant regulatory challenges.

relationships.relationship_description: NVIDIA and SoftBank Group Corp. were parties to a Share Purchase Agreement for NVIDIA to acquire Arm Limited. The agreement was terminated due to regulatory challenges.
NVIDIA was in a Share Purchase Agreement to acquire Arm Limited from SoftBank Group Corp. The agreement was terminated due to regulatory challenges.
SoftBank Group Corp. was the seller of Arm Limited in a Share Purchase Agreement with NVIDIA. The agreement was terminated due to regulatory challenges.
